Package com.w10.risk_game.models

Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
com.w10.risk_game.models.GameEngine
public class GameEngine extends Object
The GameEngine class is responsible for managing the game map, players, and their interactions in a game.
Author:
Sherwyn Dsouza

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    assignCountries()
    The function assigns countries to players in a game, ensuring that each player receives at least one country.
    void
    createPlayer(String p_playerName)
    The function creates a player with a given name and adds it to a map of players, checking for duplicate names.

    The function returns the game map.

    The function "loadMap" loads a map file using a MapReader object and assigns the loaded map to the "d_gameMap" variable.

    The function removes a player from a list of players in a game engine.

  • Method Details

    • loadMap

      public void loadMap(String p_fileName)
      The function "loadMap" loads a map file using a MapReader object and assigns the loaded map to the "d_gameMap" variable.
      Parameters:
      p_fileName - The parameter "p_fileName" is a String that represents the name of the file that contains the map data.

    • showMap

      public void showMap()
      The function "showMap" is a placeholder for adding logic to display a map.

    • createPlayer

      public void createPlayer(String p_playerName)
      The function creates a player with a given name and adds it to a map of players, checking for duplicate names.
      Parameters:
      p_playerName - The parameter "p_playerName" is a String that represents the name of the player being created.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(String p_playerName)
      The function removes a player from a list of players in a game engine.
      Parameters:
      p_playerName - The parameter "p_playerName" is a String that represents the name of the player that needs to be removed.

    • showAllPlayers

      public void showAllPlayers()
      The function "showAllPlayers" prints the names of all players and the countries they own.

    • assignCountries

      public void assignCountries()
      The function assigns countries to players in a game, ensuring that each player receives at least one country.

    • getNoOfPlayers

      public Integer getNoOfPlayers()
      The function returns the number of players in a game.
      Returns:
      The number of players in the list "d_players".

    • getGameMap

      public GameMap getGameMap()
      The function returns the game map.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an object of type GameMap.

    • getPlayerDetails

      public Player getPlayerDetails(String p_playerName)
      The function returns the details of a player based on their name.
      Parameters:
      p_playerName - The name of the player for which you want to retrieve the details.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Player object.
